meanings.definition: A shadow image produced by X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The skiagraph showed the outline of the broken bone.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the skiagraph to diagnose the injury.
meanings.sent3: The skiagraph of the teddy bear looked like a mysterious ghost.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were like skiagraphs, faint but still visible.
meanings.sent5: The skiagraph of the tree against the sunset was hauntingly beautiful.

meanings.sent1: The technician will skiagraph your teeth for the dentist.
meanings.sent2: She skiagraphed the artifact to study its internal structure.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally skiagraphed his hand on the photocopier.
meanings.sent4: Her words skiagraphed a vivid picture of the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The artist skiagraphed the landscape with precise detail.
